numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The catchy title is: Racial Diversity: Sideline Statistics.
2. I look at these graphs.
3. I notice a fact.
4. For every listed sport, the percentage of players of color is higher than the percentage of coaches of color.
5. I know that a coach stays in a league longer than a player stays in a league.
6. I know that there are more players than coaches.
7. I wonder why people of color do not get the representation that they deserve in higher positions.
8. This problem exists in sports.
9. This problem also exists in any white-dominated industry.
10. This problem could have a devastating impact on people in my community.
11. I have watched sports for my whole life.
12. I used to dream of being a basketball coach in the WNBA.
13. In the past, I never thought that I could not reach my goal.
14. In the past, I always saw people who looked like me as coaches.
15. Now I realize another fact.
16. Some of my teammates had doubts as children.
17. Some of my classmates had doubts as children.
18. Some of my friends had doubts as children.
19. They never saw people who looked like them doing what they dreamed of doing.
20. Because of this, they thought that they were not allowed to be in those positions.
21. Because of this, they thought that people did not want people who looked like them to be in those positions.
22. I can imagine a situation.
23. In this situation, a person has a dream.
24. In this situation, the person believes that the person cannot reach the dream because of the skin color that the person was born with.
25. I think that these statistics are a prime example.
26. I think that there should be more representation in sports.
27. I think that there should be more equality in sports.
28. I think that there should be more representation in positions of high regard.
29. I think that there should be more equality in positions of high regard.
